{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2990450,"name":"cmot","username":"cmot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmot/{size}/162792_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:20:05.892Z","cooked":"

For intakes that sit outside of the robot, what is normally done to help them withstand the forces of competition? (e.g. smashing into walls/other robots at high speed…)

I’m basically ready to design our intake out of 100% polycarbonate, but I’m not super experienced with good intake design.
The past two I have built were versaframe/8020 and held up very poorly due to aluminum bending after impacts.
Now that my team has a CNC, we can cut parts out of polycarb, and I’m very tempted to use it everywhere. I was even considering making the horizontal shafts that hold the intake together out of polycarb as I noticed mcmaster sells them.

I can’t help but feel like I might be using it too much.
What techniques do other teams use to design durable intakes that can withstand impacts?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:25:06.026Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":526,"reads":1336,"readers_count":1335,"score":2992.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"cmot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2990461,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:45:21.761Z","cooked":"

We’re thinking of making ours lift up out of the way once we get it loaded.

Polycarb and clever design and lots of testing might get you where you want to be. Looking at pictures of past year robots that work well also helps!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:45:21.761Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":1274,"readers_count":1273,"score":339.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/2","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990466,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:50:32.345Z","cooked":"

Make the intake retractable. Retract when not in use. Bonus if you can set it up to auto-retract when you slam into something head-on (preferably the wall, not your opponent).

Polycarb works, spring mounting works. And there’s always the option of not having an extendable intake (which I don’t recommend unless the game requires it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:50:32.345Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1267,"readers_count":1266,"score":423.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/3","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990467,"name":"","username":"BrendanB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brendanb/{size}/236167_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:51:01.329Z","cooked":"

Don’t overlook your point of attachment.

Lexan or thick aluminum plates can both make for durable intakes outside your frame perimeter. One is flexible when hit and another can be strong enough to take any hit. These only work well if they are durably mounted to your robot so I they don’t fall off during those hits.

Speaking of falling off. Double up on any exposed belts or chains. Those always love falling off.

+1 to what’s already been suggested: steal from the best in prior years.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:51:01.329Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":1231,"readers_count":1230,"score":386.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3467 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/4","custom_user_title":"3467 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990468,"name":"cmot","username":"cmot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmot/{size}/162792_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:54:41.499Z","cooked":"

We are planning for the intake to be retractable. I’ll look at using springs in various places as well. Thank you!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:54:41.499Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":1148,"readers_count":1147,"score":299.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"cmot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990470,"name":"cmot","username":"cmot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmot/{size}/162792_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T03:55:25.760Z","cooked":"

The doubling up on belts is something I hadn’t thought of, thank you!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T03:55:33.891Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":1119,"readers_count":1118,"score":278.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"cmot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10103,"username":"BrendanB","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brendanb/{size}/236167_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990486,"name":"Joseph Barry","username":"jbarry987","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/65b543/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T04:10:56.534Z","cooked":"

A properly oriented cylinder used to retract can also act as an impact dampener and absorb a lot of the momentum. An extended impulse is your friend

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T04:10:56.534Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":1097,"readers_count":1096,"score":414.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"Joseph Barry","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":40105,"username":"cmot","name":"cmot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmot/{size}/162792_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34233,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990526,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T05:25:38.318Z","cooked":"

On the topic of cylinders, make sure the mechanisms actuating your intake are sufficiently protected. It doesn’t matter if someone’s intake intrudes into your frame perimeter causing them to get a penalty if it also damages your intake permanently or so that it requires extensive repairs.

It is also helpful to design your intake system so it is not too onerous to build a backup or two and for it to be easily swapped out in a short time, just in case Murphy strikes.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T05:54:55.798Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":1071,"readers_count":1070,"score":314.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":34233,"username":"jbarry987","name":"Joseph Barry","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/65b543/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990534,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T05:33:50.873Z","cooked":"
BrendanB:

Don’t overlook your point of attachment.

This, even the best teams fall afoul of this. Never underestimate how hard your driver can slam into things…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T05:34:37.101Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1024,"readers_count":1023,"score":369.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990557,"name":"Justin Newton","username":"NustinJewton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/73ab20/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T06:10:38.630Z","cooked":"

What my former team has done quite a few times is making the base of the intake and the end(roller side) out of box tubing and aluminum and then in-between these have 4 polycarb sheets (1 for each side) attaching the end to the base. Its worked well for us every time we have done it. They will break/bend before the aluminum and then you can easily replace them between matches.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T06:10:38.630Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1004,"readers_count":1003,"score":275.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"Justin Newton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39658,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2046 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/10","custom_user_title":"2046 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990561,"name":"","username":"Falln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T06:24:50.237Z","cooked":"

If you’re looking for some up close insights on intakes, FUN’s Behind the Bumper series is a great series to take a look at. They interview top teams and explain every part of the robot (usually intake first). I’ll leave a link to 3476’s and ofc 254’s intakes which i think represent two different ideas: Rigid enough to last and flexible/modular/easy to replace.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T06:26:07.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":1014,"readers_count":1013,"score":392.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""We build each other up like we build our robot" "},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/11","custom_user_title":""We build each other up like we build our robot" ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990568,"name":"Bryce Hanson","username":"BryceHanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brycehanson/{size}/159972_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T06:45:51.654Z","cooked":"

I’m personally a big fan of having a bumper bar. One of the easiest ways to beat up an intake is running it into the corner of something. Hitting the corner of the lower exits or the hangar truss could bend your intake hex shaft. We’re adding a round tube beater bar that sits just above and in front of our first set of wheels, which will take the impact of any angle hits before the spinny parts do.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T06:45:51.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":959,"readers_count":958,"score":266.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"Bryce Hanson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"125M/7525M | MC/GA "},"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/12","custom_user_title":"125M/7525M | MC/GA ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990571,"name":"BryanLee","username":"BryanLee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bryanlee/{size}/11725_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T08:02:05.496Z","cooked":"

I have no answers, but the same question. Every year our team has stuck something outside the frame parameter, it gets destroyed. Quickly and often. In Deep Space, out hatch grabber only stuck out a few inches, but bent quickly due to impacts when picking up and placing the hatch panels if not perfectly square. That year we survived by having a known failure point that wouldn’t ruin it, just make it less effective. We had a second one and could replace it within 15 seconds, and repair it in the time of one match. In the beginning we thought it was bad that we had to fix it like twice in the first competition. By playoffs in our division at worlds, we where replacing it and fixing it every match. lol. Again, the damage to that wasn’t disabling, just slightly less effective over time. Other years things just get destroyed and are not usable for the rest of the match which is no good. We’re looking to make a good outside intake this year and also looking for the right solution. One backup is we will be able to pickup without it, it just makes pickups have a greater margin of error when hitting the cargo. Best of luck to both of us, hope we can figure out the magic solution!

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":99,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T08:02:05.496Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":953,"readers_count":952,"score":245.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400003,"topic_slug":"how-to-make-durable-intakes","display_username":"BryanLee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26492,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-make-durable-intakes/400003/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990575,"name":"Andrew Torrance","username":"Torrance","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/torrance/{size}/152754_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T08:16:37.082Z","cooked":"

Build something that deploys with springs or pneumatics and retracts/restows when you hit something head on.

Look at 1678 from 2020 or 971 from 2019.

Make side plates out of ¼” polycarbonate that is at least 2” tall. Have lots of material around any holes of bearings or bushings or standoffs, they are stress risers where cracks will form.

Make intake floppy enough that it bends and absorbs impact on a side hit. Rigid strong intake will hardly ever be able to be strong enough without being super heavy, and if it’s that heavy it probably won’t be able to easily stow when u hit head on.

If a big horizontal axle, make it out of tube and not ½” hex.

philso:

permanently or so that it requires extensive repairs.

The difference between these is often how straight you can hammer a cylinder piston rod on the floor of the pits.

Building an intake that is very flexible is a good way to prevent damage. Team 16 in 2008 is my favorite inspiration for this concept. Watch them on the blue side here: https://youtu.be/NYNEAL_dK6I
Using several layers of thin polycarbonate rather than a single thick layer to make the side panels is one way to increase this side-to-side flexibility. We are probably going to use this concept on our intake this year, though we don’t want as much flex as Baxter did in 2008!

I’ve had a lot of problems with this in the past and am surprised at how many people are saying to use an extended cylinder to cushion. That seems like a very precise force vector, and rods historically seem to bend much more than they cushion for me in practice (especially considering how bad bending can be versus how many other ways there are to cushion). I thought that I’d “learned” this lesson years ago and had since tried to design with cylinder retracted when the intake is extended. Though we haven’t ended up doing pneumatic in serious competition since I “learned” that lesson.

Is that just totally off, and there’s a better way to keep rods from bending and get a worthwhile cushion benefit vs being retracted?

3310 has built intakes for the the last 3-4 seasons that deploy out on gas shocks in auto, and never retract back into the perimeter. Saves a mechanism and a point of failure. The gas shocks serve as a spring when we hit the intake, and we just do a lot of destructive testing running the intakes into walls. Polycarb can take a beating. No complaints so far.
